Getting Started

Loading R package

pacman::p_load(tidyverse, ggplot2, plotly, dplyr)
# Load necessary libraries
library(ggplot2)
library(plotly)
library(dplyr)

# Read the dataset
data <- read.csv("data/data_filtered_analysis.csv")

# Prepare the data by grouping and summarizing
data_prepared <- data %>%
  group_by(country_txt) %>%
  summarise(Incidents = n(),
            Kills = sum(nkill, na.rm = TRUE)) %>%
  ungroup()
# Create the bubble plot
p <- ggplot(data_prepared, aes(x = Incidents, y = Kills, size = Kills, color = country_txt)) +
  geom_point(alpha = 0.7) +
  scale_size(range = c(1, 20)) + # Adjust this range based on your data to make the plot look better
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(title = "Terrorism Incidents vs. Casualties by Country, 1970 - 2023",
       x = "Number of Incidents",
       y = "Number of Casualties") +
  theme(legend.position = "none") # Optional: Adjust or remove based on preference

p_interactive <- ggplotly(p, tooltip = c("country_txt", "Incidents", "Kills"))

# Print the interactive plot
p_interactive
